This file outlines the differential equations to formalize the phenomenon of NSSI.

```{r}
# -----------------------------------------
# ---- High Arousal Negative Emotions -----
# -----------------------------------------

dA_dt <- function(A,
                  E,
                  k_SSA,
                  P,
                  r_A,
                  r_AP) {
  #E*k_SSA - r_A*A - r_AP*P*A
  E*k_SSA*A - r_A*A - r_AP*P*A
}

# HANE (A) increases only if a distressing event (E) occurs, at a rate that depends on person's level of stress susceptibility (k_SSA). HANE naturally decreases over time at rate r_A.
# E*S*A: stress is more HANE inducing when HANE is already high!
# r_AP: how relieving the pain is to HANE

# -----------------------------------------
# -------------- NSSI Urge ----------------
# -----------------------------------------

dU_dt <- function(U, 
                  A, 
                  k_SSU, 
                  m_U, 
                  r_U) {
  (1 / (1 + exp(-k_SSU*(A - m_U)))) - U*r_U
}
# If HANE (A) has passed urge threshold (m_U), urge (U) changes based on level of HANE and stress susceptibility (k_SSU). Urge naturally decreases exponentially at rate r_U.

# -----------------------------------------
# --------------- Pain --------------------
# -----------------------------------------

dP_dt <- function(P,
                  k_PS,
                  r_P,
                  N) {
  k_PS*N - r_P*P
}

# Pain (P) increases only if NSSI (N) occurs, at a rate that depends on a person's level of pain sensitivity (PS) and the current level of pain (P). Pain naturally decays at rate r_P.

# -----------------------------------------
# --------------- P(NSSI) -----------------
# -----------------------------------------

dPN_dt <- function(PN,
                   U,
                   k_I,
                   m_N,
                   r_PN) {
  (1/(1 + exp(-k_I * (U - m_N)))) - r_PN*PN
}

# If urge (U) has passed NSSI threshold (m_N), probability of NSSI (PN) changes depending on person's impulsivity (k_I). PN  naturally decreases depending on whether or not NSSI has happened (r_PN). r_PN controls how quickly PN decays after NSSI occurs.
```
